t: Psalm 119
Your Word Is a Lamp to My Feet
Aleph
Blessed*pn are those whose way is blameless, who*ld walk in the law of the Lord!*s
Blessed*ln are those who keep his testimonies, who*ld seek him with their whole heart,
who*ln also do no wrong, but*ld walk in his ways!
You*ln have commanded your precepts to*ld be kept diligently.
Oh*ln that my ways may be steadfast in*ld keeping your statutes!
Then*ln I shall not be put to shame, having*ld my eyes fixed on all your commandments.
I*ln will praise you with an upright heart, when*ld I learn your righteous rules.
I*ln will keep your statutes; do*ld not utterly forsake me!
Beth
How*pn can a young man keep his way pure? By*ld guarding it according to your word.
With*ln my whole heart I seek you; let*ld me not wander from your commandments!
I*ln have stored up your word in my heart, that*ld I might not sin against you.
Blessed*ln are you, O Lord;*s teach*ld me your statutes!
With*ln my lips I declare all*ld the rules of your mouth.
In*ln the way of your testimonies I delight as*ld much as in all riches.
I*ln will meditate on your precepts and*ld fix my eyes on your ways.
I*ln will delight in your statutes; I*ld will not forget your word.
Gimel
Deal*pn bountifully with your servant, that*ld I may live and keep your word.
Open*ln my eyes, that I may behold wondrous*ld things out of your law.
I*ln am a sojourner on the earth; hide*ld not your commandments from me!
My*ln soul is consumed with longing for*ld your rules at all times.
You*ln rebuke the insolent, accursed ones, who*ld wander from your commandments.
Take*ln away from me scorn and contempt, for*ld I have kept your testimonies.
Even*ln though princes sit plotting against me, your*ld servant will meditate on your statutes.
Your*ln testimonies are my delight; they*ld are my counselors.
Daleth
My*pn soul clings to the dust; give*ld me life according to your word!
When*ln I told of my ways, you answered me; teach*ld me your statutes!
Make*ln me understand the way of your precepts, and*ld I will meditate on your wondrous works.
My*ln soul melts away for sorrow; strengthen*ld me according to your word!

I*ln have chosen the way of faithfulness; I*ld set your rules before me.
I*ln cling to your testimonies, O Lord;*s let*ld me not be put to shame!
I*ln will run in the way of your commandments when*ld you enlarge my heart!
He
Teach*pn me, O Lord,*s the way of your statutes; and*ld I will keep it to the end.
Give*ln me understanding, that I may keep your law and*ld observe it with my whole heart.
Lead*ln me in the path of your commandments, for*ld I delight in it.
Incline*ln my heart to your testimonies, and*ld not to selfish gain!
Turn*ln my eyes from looking at worthless things; and*ld give me life in your ways.
Confirm*ln to your servant your promise, that*ld you may be feared.
Turn*ln away the reproach that I dread, for*ld your rules are good.
Behold,*ln I long for your precepts; in*ld your righteousness give me life!
Waw
Let*pn your steadfast love come to me, O Lord,*s your*ld salvation according to your promise;
then*ln shall I have an answer for him who taunts me, for*ld I trust in your word.
And*ln take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth, for*ld my hope is in your rules.
I*ln will keep your law continually, forever*ld and ever,
and*ln I shall walk in a wide place, for*ld I have sought your precepts.
I*ln will also speak of your testimonies before kings and*ld shall not be put to shame,
for*ln I find my delight in your commandments, which*ld I love.

Zayin
Remember*pn your word to your servant, in*ld which you have made me hope.
This*ln is my comfort in my affliction, that*ld your promise gives me life.
The*ln insolent utterly deride me, but*ld I do not turn away from your law.
When*ln I think of your rules from of old, I*ld take comfort, O Lord.*s
Hot*ln indignation seizes me because of the wicked, who*ld forsake your law.
Your*ln statutes have been my songs in*ld the house of my sojourning.
I*ln remember your name in the night, O Lord,*s and*ld keep your law.
This*ln blessing has fallen to me, that*ld I have kept your precepts.
Heth
The*pn Lord*s is my portion; I*ld promise to keep your words.
I*ln entreat your favor with all my heart; be*ld gracious to me according to your promise.
When*ln I think on my ways, I*ld turn my feet to your testimonies;
I*ln hasten and do not delay to*ld keep your commandments.
Though*ln the cords of the wicked ensnare me, I*ld do not forget your law.
At*ln midnight I rise to praise you, because*ld of your righteous rules.
I*ln am a companion of all who fear you, of*ld those who keep your precepts.
The*ln earth, O Lord,*s is full of your steadfast love; teach*ld me your statutes!
Teth
You*pn have dealt well with your servant, O*ld Lord,*s according to your word.
Teach*ln me good judgment and knowledge, for*ld I believe in your commandments.
Before*ln I was afflicted I went astray, but*ld now I keep your word.
You*ln are good and do good; teach*ld me your statutes.
The*ln insolent smear me with lies, but*ld with my whole heart I keep your precepts;
their*ln heart is unfeeling like fat, but*ld I delight in your law.
It*ln is good for me that I was afflicted, that*ld I might learn your statutes.
The*ln law of your mouth is better to me than*ld thousands of gold and silver pieces.
Yodh
Your*pn hands have made and fashioned me; give*ld me understanding that I may learn your commandments.
Those*ln who fear you shall see me and rejoice, because*ld I have hoped in your word.
I*ln know, O Lord,*s that your rules are righteous, and*ld that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.
Let*ln your steadfast love comfort me according*ld to your promise to your servant.
Let*ln your mercy come to me, that I may live; for*ld your law is my delight.
Let*ln the insolent be put to shame, because*ld they have wronged me with falsehood; as*ld for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
Let*ln those who fear you turn to me, that*ld they may know your testimonies.
May*ln my heart be blameless in your statutes, that*ld I may not be put to shame!
Kaph
My*pn soul longs for your salvation; I*ld hope in your word.
My*ln eyes long for your promise; I*ld ask, “When will you comfort me?”
For*ln I have become like a wineskin in the smoke, yet*ld I have not forgotten your statutes.
How*ln long must your servant endure? When*ld will you judge those who persecute me?
The*ln insolent have dug pitfalls for me; they*ld do not live according to your law.
All*ln your commandments are sure; they*ld persecute me with falsehood; help me!
They*ln have almost made an end of me on earth, but*ld I have not forsaken your precepts.
In*ln your steadfast love give me life, that*ld I may keep the testimonies of your mouth.
Lamedh
Forever,*pn O Lord,*s your word is*ld firmly fixed in the heavens.
Your*ln faithfulness endures to all generations; you*ld have established the earth, and it stands fast.
By*ln your appointment they stand this day, for*ld all things are your servants.
If*ln your law had not been my delight, I*ld would have perished in my affliction.
I*ln will never forget your precepts, for*ld by them you have given me life.

The*ln wicked lie in wait to destroy me, but*ld I consider your testimonies.
I*ln have seen a limit to all perfection, but*ld your commandment is exceedingly broad.
Mem
Oh*pn how I love your law! It*ld is my meditation all the day.
Your*ln commandment makes me wiser than my enemies, for*ld it is ever with me.

I*ln do not turn aside from your rules, for*ld you have taught me.

Through*ln your precepts I get understanding; therefore*ld I hate every false way.
Nun
Your*pn word is a lamp to my feet and*ld a light to my path.
I*ln have sworn an oath and confirmed it, to*ld keep your righteous rules.
I*ln am severely afflicted; give*ld me life, O Lord,*s according to your word!

I*ln hold my life in my hand continually, but*ld I do not forget your law.
The*ln wicked have laid a snare for me, but*ld I do not stray from your precepts.
Your*ln testimonies are my heritage forever, for*ld they are the joy of my heart.
I*ln incline my heart to perform your statutes forever,*ld to the end.
Samekh
I*pn hate the double-minded, but*ld I love your law.
You*ln are my hiding place and my shield; I*ld hope in your word.
Depart*ln from me, you evildoers, that*ld I may keep the commandments of my God.
Uphold*ln me according to your promise, that I may live, and*ld let me not be put to shame in my hope!
Hold*ln me up, that I may be safe and*ld have regard for your statutes continually!
You*ln spurn all who go astray from your statutes, for*ld their cunning is in vain.
All*ln the wicked of the earth you discard like dross, therefore*ld I love your testimonies.
My*ln flesh trembles for fear of you, and*ld I am afraid of your judgments.
Ayin
I*pn have done what is just and right; do*ld not leave me to my oppressors.
Give*ln your servant a pledge of good; let*ld not the insolent oppress me.
My*ln eyes long for your salvation and*ld for the fulfillment of your righteous promise.
Deal*ln with your servant according to your steadfast love, and*ld teach me your statutes.
I*ln am your servant; give me understanding, that*ld I may know your testimonies!
It*ln is time for the Lord*s to act, for*ld your law has been broken.
Therefore*ln I love your commandments above*ld gold, above fine gold.
Therefore*ln I consider all your precepts to be right; I*ld hate every false way.
Pe
Your*pn testimonies are wonderful; therefore*ld my soul keeps them.
The*ln unfolding of your words gives light; it*ld imparts understanding to the simple.
I*ln open my mouth and pant, because*ld I long for your commandments.

My*ln eyes shed streams of tears, because*ld people do not keep your law.
Tsadhe
Righteous*pn are you, O Lord,*s and*ld right are your rules.
You*ln have appointed your testimonies in righteousness and*ld in all faithfulness.

Qoph
With*pn my whole heart I cry; answer me, O Lord!*s I*ld will keep your statutes.

Resh

Sin and Shin
Princes*pn persecute me without cause, but*ld my heart stands in awe of your words.

Taw
